(cherry picked from commit f899ee2e0e42d3e106c9e1c916aff0c92f486a48)

subject: Use RDO instead of EPEL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 20:04:52.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml'], 'message': "Use RDO instead of EPEL

Both RDO and EPEL repositories offer similar packages and this creates
conflicts at times, especially with RabbitMQ. This patch installs RDO
instead of EPEL to ensure that each container starts out with RDO and
not EPEL.

Some of the -devel packages are also removed that are no longer needed
now that we're installing LXC exclusively from packages on CentOS 7.

Related-bug: 1670012
Change-Id: I09ef74f1808e8883af2ecd6acab3b6418e7de1e6
(cherry picked from commit 7a92a1ee69f06bd5513317f7d84060d7cc7ed066)
"}]
commit_message:
Use RDO instead of EPEL

Both RDO and EPEL repositories offer similar packages and this creates
conflicts at times, especially with RabbitMQ. This patch installs RDO
instead of EPEL to ensure that each container starts out with RDO and
not EPEL.

Some of the -devel packages are also removed that are no longer needed
now that we're installing LXC exclusively from packages on CentOS 7.

Related-bug: 1670012
Change-Id: I09ef74f1808e8883af2ecd6acab3b6418e7de1e6
(cherry picked from commit 7a92a1ee69f06bd5513317f7d84060d7cc7ed066)

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: Ia9d09515435618624919ad715ffa3df833a50a7a
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit 28c04297b2751f3d5dea152cadc1469033d7e1c7)

commit_message:
Default rbac_flag = True for testing in gates.

Workaround so that testing jobs in tempest gates is automatically
kicked off for admin, until the test hooks are properly
configured.

Change-Id: I07012147f50f74c9996dd2634d090ed76b49c5c5

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-04 23:40:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_rpc_base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_securitygroups_rpc.py'], 'message': "Don't refresh all security group filters when updating DHCP port

Instead of forcing a refresh/rebuild of all security group filter
rules on all ports on the network when a DHCP port is changed, just
do nothing.  This is not necessary as VM ports automatically get
rules allowing the DHCP ports through, anyway.

Refreshing all filters on all ports generates considerable load on
neutron-server and the backend database for networks with a large
number of ports.

Change-Id: I2e9a70c7ea7c2c0015b8fba6f460d14f2c4837de
Closes-Bug: #1653830
"}]
commit_message:
Don't refresh all security group filters when updating DHCP port

Instead of forcing a refresh/rebuild of all security group filter
rules on all ports on the network when a DHCP port is changed, just
do nothing.  This is not necessary as VM ports automatically get
rules allowing the DHCP ports through, anyway.

Refreshing all filters on all ports generates considerable load on
neutron-server and the backend database for networks with a large
number of ports.

Change-Id: I2e9a70c7ea7c2c0015b8fba6f460d14f2c4837de
Closes-Bug: #1653830

subject: Sync neutron callbacks into lib
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-02 19:58:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/callbacks/events.py', 'neutron_lib/callbacks/resources.py', 'neutron_lib/callbacks/registry.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/callbacks/test_registry.py'], 'message': "Sync neutron callbacks into lib

A few commits have come into neutron's callback
modules in the past weeks. This patch syncs the latest
from neutron into neutron-lib's callback package.

Note that new decorators have been added to the
registry module. While these are not battle tested
(yet) they are isolated and only executed when using
the new decorators. Therefore they are low risk.

Change-Id: I87685a3da1e1ca14e4dd0941bfbc0bf96f24ecc5
"}]
commit_message:
Sync neutron callbacks into lib

A few commits have come into neutron's callback
modules in the past weeks. This patch syncs the latest
from neutron into neutron-lib's callback package.

Note that new decorators have been added to the
registry module. While these are not battle tested
(yet) they are isolated and only executed when using
the new decorators. Therefore they are low risk.

Change-Id: I87685a3da1e1ca14e4dd0941bfbc0bf96f24ecc5

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: I86990deffcf9c29d39190defb0e2178a39de2aba

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-06 17:02:52.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': "Ignore second enable_plugin request

There are situations when DEVSTACK_PLUGINS variable is set
while _DEVSTACK_STACKRC is not. In this case plugin will be enabled twice,
even when 'enable_plugin ...' is added only once in local.conf.
Instead of failing here, we ignore second attempt.

Closes-Bug: #1669509

Change-Id: I940e732278257cd759bd9bc4744c1fc1267d06f5
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore second enable_plugin request

There are situations when DEVSTACK_PLUGINS variable is set
while _DEVSTACK_STACKRC is not. In this case plugin will be enabled twice,
even when 'enable_plugin ...' is added only once in local.conf.
Instead of failing here, we ignore second attempt.

Closes-Bug: #1669509

Change-Id: I940e732278257cd759bd9bc4744c1fc1267d06f5

commit_message:
Move Docker registry setup into its own profile

The new tripleo::profile::base::docker_registry profile sets up
a v2 registry instead of the old, deprecated v1 registry.

Related BZ: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1428826

Change-Id: I89e14cc2a27299ce4c191d2a823deb0424693831
Depends-On: I1f93b404085f0bc2b6c063f573c801db6409c0bb
(cherry picked from commit 62291b31871f411c193379036964ee222a739064)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-22 16:01:08.000000000', 'files': ['mistral_lib/actions/base.py', 'mistral_lib/actions/security.py', 'mistral_lib/utils/__init__.py', 'mistral_lib/utils/threading.py', 'mistral_lib/actions/exceptions.py', 'mistral_lib/actions/types.py', 'mistral_lib/exceptions.py', 'mistral_lib/utils/keystone.py', 'mistral_lib/utils/execution.py', 'mistral_lib/context.py', 'mistral_lib/actions/api/utils.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Porting Security Related Code to Mistral-Lib

The custom actions need access to the keystone_utils.  To port
this code over properly, we also need the context, exceptions
and a few utility methods.

The patch proposed here is to illustrate the task and get some
feedback in the direction that should be taken.

Note: There are no tests currently in the patch.  I plan to add
      them after I receive some feedback.

Change-Id: Ib744ade29418e287d0bcc622b9979940a22422cb
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Porting Security Related Code to Mistral-Lib

The custom actions need access to the keystone_utils.  To port
this code over properly, we also need the context, exceptions
and a few utility methods.

The patch proposed here is to illustrate the task and get some
feedback in the direction that should be taken.

Note: There are no tests currently in the patch.  I plan to add
      them after I receive some feedback.

Change-Id: Ib744ade29418e287d0bcc622b9979940a22422cb

commit_message:
Add support for DBDeadlock handling

Wrap all DB write operations with oslo_db decorator to retry on
deadlock. DBDeadlock exception can be raised quite often on Galera
clusters under load.
This also fixes an issue which causes conductor's periodic
tasks to stop executing.

commit_message:
Remove with_items from utility pip install

The utility container already combines all of the packages into one
install, and then it runs the entire grouped install across the
utility containers multiple times for each element in
utility_pip_packages.

Change-Id: I844c05f57fa8552bacb850b00b51a27354ff5e53
(cherry picked from commit a39837aec19a8aa67bb8444c7b0bf04d8279709f)

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-04-17 21:21:34.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/log.py'], 'message': 'Fix maintain old oslo loggers names

Closes-Bug: #1567902

We should not change names of loggers.
It is't help if somebody to want to use direct import
of python logging module like it does in:

oslo_messaging
oslo_config
oslo_vmware
oslo_reports
oslo_concurrency
oslo_service
oslo_rootwrap
...

This projects still create non-namespaced
loggers despite of changes in the getLogger
method of oslo log, becase they do not use
oslo log.

Instead of this, just fix the naming style
when a logging level is set for oslo modules
in the '_setup_logging_from_conf' method.

It is to allow a configuration of log levels with both
of styles: oslo.x and oslo_x.

To allow usage the global log level for oslo
projects ("oslo=X") we explicitly set a level
for each project in the list.

Change-Id: I2ae65a626450b928fe6d097fac676a7a5d9062fc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix maintain old oslo loggers names

Closes-Bug: #1567902

We should not change names of loggers.
It is't help if somebody to want to use direct import
of python logging module like it does in:

oslo_messaging
oslo_config
oslo_vmware
oslo_reports
oslo_concurrency
oslo_service
oslo_rootwrap
...

This projects still create non-namespaced
loggers despite of changes in the getLogger
method of oslo log, becase they do not use
oslo log.

Instead of this, just fix the naming style
when a logging level is set for oslo modules
in the '_setup_logging_from_conf' method.

It is to allow a configuration of log levels with both
of styles: oslo.x and oslo_x.

To allow usage the global log level for oslo
projects ("oslo=X") we explicitly set a level
for each project in the list.

Change-Id: I2ae65a626450b928fe6d097fac676a7a5d9062fc

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than

which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to

Change-Id: I792427363cda300650d2ce1c0fdab9973be7b348

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove os-apply-config.

Change-Id: I792427363cda300650d2ce1c0fdab9973be7b348

subject: Spec: tripleo-routed-networks-deployment - Routed Spine and Leaf
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-02 17:06:29.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'specs/ocata/tripleo-routed-networks-deployment.rst'], 'message': 'Spec: tripleo-routed-networks-deployment - Routed Spine and Leaf

This spec covers the scope of work required to enable deployment
of TripleO in a routed network environment. A routed network
design, also known as "Spine and Leaf", or "Clos" architecture,
allows for horizontal scalability where each group of servers is
inside its own set of layer 2 subnets, and subnets are connected
via routers. This allows for a larger number of total nodes,
since the broadcast, multicast, and unknown unicast (BUM traffic)
is isolated to the local layer 2 domain. Furthermore, equal-cost
multipath (ECMP) can provide better distribution of traffic
between multiple uplinks in large deployments.

There are multiple projects which will need to be enhanced to add
features for routed newtorks. The DHCP services provided by both
Neutron and Ironic Inspector need to be enhanced to provide
routersfor each subnet. The use of Neutron as an IP address
management (IPAM) backend will need to be evaluated, to determine
if we need features that were added to support routed networks in
Neutron. The TripleO Heat templates will need to be refactored in
order to support multiple subnets. We may need some enhancements
to os-net-config (to be determined).

This spec attempts to break down the overall goals by the problem
set as it applies to each project. If additional detail is
required for any particular project, it may make sense to break
it out into its own spec.  This spec will likely take more than
one cycle to implement, so it may be retargetted for Pike, or
broken out into multiple specs targetting both Ocata and Pike.

Change-Id: I2f6f9d30a62561717f2fd3d2b44e68ef21b6427e
'}]
commit_message:
Spec: tripleo-routed-networks-deployment - Routed Spine and Leaf

This spec covers the scope of work required to enable deployment
of TripleO in a routed network environment. A routed network
design, also known as "Spine and Leaf", or "Clos" architecture,
allows for horizontal scalability where each group of servers is
inside its own set of layer 2 subnets, and subnets are connected
via routers. This allows for a larger number of total nodes,
since the broadcast, multicast, and unknown unicast (BUM traffic)
is isolated to the local layer 2 domain. Furthermore, equal-cost
multipath (ECMP) can provide better distribution of traffic
between multiple uplinks in large deployments.

There are multiple projects which will need to be enhanced to add
features for routed newtorks. The DHCP services provided by both
Neutron and Ironic Inspector need to be enhanced to provide
routersfor each subnet. The use of Neutron as an IP address
management (IPAM) backend will need to be evaluated, to determine
if we need features that were added to support routed networks in
Neutron. The TripleO Heat templates will need to be refactored in
order to support multiple subnets. We may need some enhancements
to os-net-config (to be determined).

This spec attempts to break down the overall goals by the problem
set as it applies to each project. If additional detail is
required for any particular project, it may make sense to break
it out into its own spec.  This spec will likely take more than
one cycle to implement, so it may be retargetted for Pike, or
broken out into multiple specs targetting both Ocata and Pike.

Change-Id: I2f6f9d30a62561717f2fd3d2b44e68ef21b6427e

commit_message:
[Core] Make task engine more abstract

This patch removes a lot of openstack staff from task engines
and makes it more abstract.

* Added proper validation of tasks that use both users
  and existing users.
* Moved all openstack scenarios to openstack namespace.

Change-Id: I1ee65f831c12d2e1168f3701680b6985e06c10c6

commit_message:
Add server test for image and flavor lookups

Review Ia66e44e530799ce6531922dcf6a84e38528c8725 changes OSC's server
commands to use the image client rather than compute clirnt (yay!)
but we never really tested any of this in functional tests.  This review
adds a simple functional test (in the new style) to watch the client
change; it passes locally for me without the client change, due to timing
we went ahead and merged that first.

Change-Id: I5529f412578c50090e70d17aa0129217bf803fed
(cherry picked from commit 9ada3b529d60c174b7daa8db2a2fe5ebe619cced)

subject: Use RDO instead of EPEL
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-06 19:02:28.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml'], 'message': "Use RDO instead of EPEL

Both RDO and EPEL repositories offer similar packages and this creates
conflicts at times, especially with RabbitMQ. This patch installs RDO
instead of EPEL to ensure that each container starts out with RDO and
not EPEL.

Some of the -devel packages are also removed that are no longer needed
now that we're installing LXC exclusively from packages on CentOS 7.

Related-bug: 1670012
Change-Id: I09ef74f1808e8883af2ecd6acab3b6418e7de1e6
"}]
commit_message:
Use RDO instead of EPEL

Both RDO and EPEL repositories offer similar packages and this creates
conflicts at times, especially with RabbitMQ. This patch installs RDO
instead of EPEL to ensure that each container starts out with RDO and
not EPEL.

Some of the -devel packages are also removed that are no longer needed
now that we're installing LXC exclusively from packages on CentOS 7.

Related-bug: 1670012
Change-Id: I09ef74f1808e8883af2ecd6acab3b6418e7de1e6

commit_message:
layout/tripleo: fix logic for scenarios & voting

- Make sure scenario004-upgrade never runs as voting. This job never
  passed yet. It will vote soon.
- Make sure we don't run gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-multinode-upgrades-nv
  in stable/ocata, we only want
  gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-multinode-upgrades.
- Other way around, make sure gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-multinode-upgrades-nv
  runs on master and not gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-multinode-upgrades.

subject: Add empty volume item check in kolla_docker module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-21 09:18:04.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/library/kolla_docker.py'], 'message': 'Add empty volume item check in kolla_docker module

A empty docker volume item will cause start_container to fail.
This bug is not triggered in current kolla deployment scripts, but
only if you pass a empty volume item to kolla_docker module.
E.g. Using a if expression in items of volumes list while calling
start_container. Like the one in start.yml of iscsi and cinder.

Change-Id: I389246fb9650ab5304463e943459ecb68706167f
'}]
commit_message:
Add empty volume item check in kolla_docker module

A empty docker volume item will cause start_container to fail.
This bug is not triggered in current kolla deployment scripts, but
only if you pass a empty volume item to kolla_docker module.
E.g. Using a if expression in items of volumes list while calling
start_container. Like the one in start.yml of iscsi and cinder.

Change-Id: I389246fb9650ab5304463e943459ecb68706167f

subject: Fix pushing images to local registry documentation
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-03 15:55:46.000000000', 'files': ['doc/multinode.rst'], 'message': 'Fix pushing images to local registry documentation

Adding -e REGISTRY_PROXY_REMOTEURL=https://registry-1.docker.io to the
docker run command in the start-registry script configures the local
registry as a pull through cache. However, pushing of images to the
local registry fails.

Pushing to a registry configured as a pull-through cache is unsupported.
For more information, reference the proxy section in Docker
Documentation (https://docs.docker.com/registry/configuration/)

The start_registry script has been updated in the patch set
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426338/

Change-Id: If62b40d8316af7c3593523493cad8a904d35dceb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pushing images to local registry documentation

Adding -e REGISTRY_PROXY_REMOTEURL=https://registry-1.docker.io to the
docker run command in the start-registry script configures the local
registry as a pull through cache. However, pushing of images to the
local registry fails.

Pushing to a registry configured as a pull-through cache is unsupported.
For more information, reference the proxy section in Docker
Documentation (https://docs.docker.com/registry/configuration/)

The start_registry script has been updated in the patch set
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426338/

Change-Id: If62b40d8316af7c3593523493cad8a904d35dceb

subject: Add tips for writing good release notes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 16:55:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/release-management.rst'], 'message': 'Add tips for writing good release notes

"Include a release note" has become a checkbox in some projects,
leading to every single patch having a reno note that vaguely rephrases
the git commit message or bug title, without considering how it may be
relevant to or make sense to a user not already familiar with the day
to day churn of the project.

The current guidelines explaining "when" a release note is needed are
useful, but don't seem sufficient to help people understand "how" to
write a good note that is both slightly more fleshed out than rewording
the git commit message title and also relevant to users.

This patch aims to be a starting point for being more explicit. If
there is existing documentation about this in OpenStack or elsewhere,
they would be good to reference as well.

Change-Id: I45c277d332ce8e670ef237122039445ca90477fe
'}]
commit_message:
Add tips for writing good release notes

"Include a release note" has become a checkbox in some projects,
leading to every single patch having a reno note that vaguely rephrases
the git commit message or bug title, without considering how it may be
relevant to or make sense to a user not already familiar with the day
to day churn of the project.

The current guidelines explaining "when" a release note is needed are
useful, but don't seem sufficient to help people understand "how" to
write a good note that is both slightly more fleshed out than rewording
the git commit message title and also relevant to users.

This patch aims to be a starting point for being more explicit. If
there is existing documentation about this in OpenStack or elsewhere,
they would be good to reference as well.

Change-Id: I45c277d332ce8e670ef237122039445ca90477fe

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 15:55:59.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rhel6stig/misc.yml'], 'message': "Add missing STIG ID tags

The 'Set fact for SNMP being installed' and 'Set fact for vsftpd being
installed' tasks rely on variables being registered by other tasks. If
those other tasks are skipped by tag, Ansible can fail with an undefined
variable error. Add the appropriate STIG ID tags to these set_fact tasks
to include them when skipping by tags.

Change-Id: If6345d7095676cc703140ab95d60a5383a5ebef0
(cherry picked from commit 209ce55e5661d3544a2f91a34e8ad51a48f4b996)
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing STIG ID tags

The 'Set fact for SNMP being installed' and 'Set fact for vsftpd being
installed' tasks rely on variables being registered by other tasks. If
those other tasks are skipped by tag, Ansible can fail with an undefined
variable error. Add the appropriate STIG ID tags to these set_fact tasks
to include them when skipping by tags.

Change-Id: If6345d7095676cc703140ab95d60a5383a5ebef0
(cherry picked from commit 209ce55e5661d3544a2f91a34e8ad51a48f4b996)

subject: Don't use delorean-ci repo for upgrade deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 14:59:37.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': "Don't use delorean-ci repo for upgrade deployment

The initial deploy uses UPGRADE_RELEASE branch, which is the previous
release, not the branch under test.  This means, because Depends-On
and ZUUL_REFS aren't branch-aware, that we can only test packages for
the current branch, and we have to disable delorean-ci to avoid pulling
in e.g master puppet-tripleo on a newton deployment due to
Depends-On.

Change-Id: I8222da355fa7a7134b695a45d815caa640b8029b
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use delorean-ci repo for upgrade deployment

The initial deploy uses UPGRADE_RELEASE branch, which is the previous
release, not the branch under test.  This means, because Depends-On
and ZUUL_REFS aren't branch-aware, that we can only test packages for
the current branch, and we have to disable delorean-ci to avoid pulling
in e.g master puppet-tripleo on a newton deployment due to
Depends-On.

Change-Id: I8222da355fa7a7134b695a45d815caa640b8029b

subject: Allow checking if notifier is enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 16:48:05.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/notify/test_notifier.py', 'oslo_messaging/notify/notifier.py'], 'message': 'Allow checking if notifier is enabled

Generating the payload of a notificatiton might be expensive due
to database access. This expensive step is unnecessary if the
notification driver is set to noop because it means that the
generated payload will not be sent.

This patch makes it possible for the user of the notifier to check
if the notifier will emit any notification before the payload
is generated.

Cinder already implemented similar behavior in
I77f655d3ef90088ce71304da5d4ea7b543991e90 and nova also plans
to do it in I3e6741d59df49e1e58409314008c2ed609fdedc1

Change-Id: Ib992f5c20fef85224fb00823e1d8d9c6cff19bec
'}]
commit_message:
Allow checking if notifier is enabled

Generating the payload of a notificatiton might be expensive due
to database access. This expensive step is unnecessary if the
notification driver is set to noop because it means that the
generated payload will not be sent.

This patch makes it possible for the user of the notifier to check
if the notifier will emit any notification before the payload
is generated.

Cinder already implemented similar behavior in
I77f655d3ef90088ce71304da5d4ea7b543991e90 and nova also plans
to do it in I3e6741d59df49e1e58409314008c2ed609fdedc1

Change-Id: Ib992f5c20fef85224fb00823e1d8d9c6cff19bec

commit_message:
Move repo URL variables to defaults

This patch deprecates the apt/yum specific variables
and moves the common URL variable to defaults to make
it possible to override without using extra-vars.

This technique matches the mechanism used in the
galera_server role.

Change-Id: Iaf9a23d1cbc0601d13bf2e467437d3775da9c812
Related-Bug: #1669897
(cherry picked from commit e106ac12b2baa3bea18c916238b742601205c267)

commit_message:
Avoid 'NoneType' error when format conversion

Error raise when changing a 'None' data to a new format:
"TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable"
we also met that bug before in the previous patch [1]

This change is to handle the 'None' data and avoid
the error

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420420/

Change-Id: I649b4fc65ef7c19b8193b07f3bd59f00e6095f9f
Closes-bug: #1656363

subject: Optimize get_firewalls_for_tenant implementation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 08:16:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Optimize get_firewalls_for_tenant implementation

Currently get_firewalls_for_tenant calls* get_firewalls to get tenant
firewalls and get_firewall_routers for each tenant firewall to get
firewall router-ids. We can avoid to call get_firewall_routers because
get_firewalls also returns firewall router-ids!

This change optimizes get_firewalls_for_tenant implementation by
removing these non-necessary get_firewall_routers calls.

Change-Id: I89e9665bca033efb1c93039d044a74e032e78327
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize get_firewalls_for_tenant implementation

Currently get_firewalls_for_tenant calls* get_firewalls to get tenant
firewalls and get_firewall_routers for each tenant firewall to get
firewall router-ids. We can avoid to call get_firewall_routers because
get_firewalls also returns firewall router-ids!

This change optimizes get_firewalls_for_tenant implementation by
removing these non-necessary get_firewall_routers calls.

Change-Id: I89e9665bca033efb1c93039d044a74e032e78327

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-03 13:47:27.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py', 'muranodashboard/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': "Backport test_toggle_public_package ui test fix.

Backport from master.

Currently, 2 tests:
  - test_toggle_public_package
  - test_toggle_public_multiple_packages
both throw keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure
errors during tearDown [0].

Since these are the only two tests that dynamically create
a project using keystoneclient and delete the projects
in tearDown, this patch provides a workaround by removing
the create_project function and removing the need to then
clean up the project in tearDown.

This is done by relying on the alternate project 'service'
(already used in test_sharing_app_without_permission),
instead of having to create a new project then deleting it.

Also combines https://review.openstack.org/#/c/440219/
to fix flake8 error.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/436240/

Change-Id: Id77e0cc59f33fdf394e2dc25a9fda0fd13c5b4fa
(cherry picked from commit 9cede6d00bd9eed8e628e11a8213ebebd6c9139a)
"}]
commit_message:
Backport test_toggle_public_package ui test fix.

Backport from master.

Currently, 2 tests:
  - test_toggle_public_package
  - test_toggle_public_multiple_packages
both throw keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure
errors during tearDown [0].

Since these are the only two tests that dynamically create
a project using keystoneclient and delete the projects
in tearDown, this patch provides a workaround by removing
the create_project function and removing the need to then
clean up the project in tearDown.

This is done by relying on the alternate project 'service'
(already used in test_sharing_app_without_permission),
instead of having to create a new project then deleting it.

Also combines https://review.openstack.org/#/c/440219/
to fix flake8 error.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/436240/

Change-Id: Id77e0cc59f33fdf394e2dc25a9fda0fd13c5b4fa
(cherry picked from commit 9cede6d00bd9eed8e628e11a8213ebebd6c9139a)

commit_message:
nova/libvirt: switch vnc server binding

On compute nodes, instead of binding vnc server on 0.0.0.0, use the IP
address provided by libvirt's t-h-t profile (hiera).

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ie377c09734e9f6170daa519aed69c53fc67c366b
Change-Id: If6b116b238a52144aad5e76c9edc7df6aa15313c
Closes-Bug: #1660099

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-01 18:51:47.000000000', 'files': ['grafana/devstack.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Migrate -platform- devstack jobs to -neutron-full-""

Another attempt to introduce the change. Previously, the change was
reverted because trusty job started voting for all projects in master,
not just devstack. Now that the -trusty flavour is gone, it shouldn't be
an issue (?).

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Migrate -platform- devstack jobs to -neutron-full-""

Another attempt to introduce the change. Previously, the change was
reverted because trusty job started voting for all projects in master,
not just devstack. Now that the -trusty flavour is gone, it shouldn't be
an issue (?).

This reverts commit be80b4f85d5c693e341006f4420753e5a58e923e.

Change-Id: Iaebd7ff95baab63a2e5b70ebbef1985dae67af94

subject: [Test] Fix randomly failing unit test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 16:14:06.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': '[Test] Fix randomly failing unit test

Because of BackupHelper.__del__ that uses os.path.exists,
there is a probability that __del__ will happen during running
of test_generate_random_path and it will grab a value
from mock.side_effect that as a result will lead to an error.

Solution:
Replace side_effect tuple with lambda-function that will
react to a specific value instead of hard coded return values.

Change-Id: I965041049079520a0aa354ddef32aeba047195ba
'}]
commit_message:
[Test] Fix randomly failing unit test

Because of BackupHelper.__del__ that uses os.path.exists,
there is a probability that __del__ will happen during running
of test_generate_random_path and it will grab a value
from mock.side_effect that as a result will lead to an error.

Solution:
Replace side_effect tuple with lambda-function that will
react to a specific value instead of hard coded return values.

Change-Id: I965041049079520a0aa354ddef32aeba047195ba

subject: Remove EPEL and use RDO instead
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-06 15:40:40.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/replace-epel-df390980c03bbaa8.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove EPEL and use RDO instead

This patch removes the epel-release package whenever the pip_install
role is applied and should eliminate package conflicts between RDO
and EPEL. The RDO package path is also adjusted to download the RDO
package from repos.fedorapeople.org (which slashes 3 HTTP redirects
out of the 5 when using rdoproject.org).

This is a breaking change for OSA deployments which are already
deployed on CentOS. Some containers may need to be rebuilt after
making this change.

Related-bug: 1670012
Change-Id: I2e69fac6368c032e237ca35839dd09dab9b0c5c0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove EPEL and use RDO instead

This patch removes the epel-release package whenever the pip_install
role is applied and should eliminate package conflicts between RDO
and EPEL. The RDO package path is also adjusted to download the RDO
package from repos.fedorapeople.org (which slashes 3 HTTP redirects
out of the 5 when using rdoproject.org).

This is a breaking change for OSA deployments which are already
deployed on CentOS. Some containers may need to be rebuilt after
making this change.

Related-bug: 1670012
Change-Id: I2e69fac6368c032e237ca35839dd09dab9b0c5c0

revisions:

for full unit test coverage. This patch does just that.

Also made clear_rbac_roles a private class by prefixing it with
'_', and moved a validation method from __init__ which checked

commit_message:
Increase unit test coverage for rbac_utils.

With recent framework changes, need unit tests needed to be added
for full unit test coverage. This patch does just that.

Also made clear_rbac_roles a private class by prefixing it with
'_', and moved a validation method from __init__ which checked
whether admin_role_id or rbac_role_id were None to switch_role,
so that this check is performed more than just during the
initialization.

Change-Id: Iba261989d9cbffba9d33aec0d4f48c3fcc83092e

commit_message:
Replace functions 'dict.get' and 'del' with 'dict.pop'

Refactoring code: Making dict to use single instruction: pop()
rather than two instructions: get() and del, giving the codes a
format that carries through.

TrivialRefactoring

Change-Id: Idb21df37c287fdff24c29153676f82544f735297

Creating and immediately deleting a snapshot greater than 50GB
fails. This patch rectifies the issue by passing the

function when creating the snapshot.

Change-Id: I5aa4a77cb8208bb805551074a28d8b722d6eb22c
Closes-Bug: #1662950
(cherry picked from commit 3cdbcba1e26cc0bc6e984adc6152066422af65cb)
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - snapshot creation and immediate deletion fix

Creating and immediately deleting a snapshot greater than 50GB
fails. This patch rectifies the issue by passing the
WaitForCopyState parameter into the CreateElementReplica SMI-S
function when creating the snapshot.

Change-Id: I5aa4a77cb8208bb805551074a28d8b722d6eb22c
Closes-Bug: #1662950
(cherry picked from commit 3cdbcba1e26cc0bc6e984adc6152066422af65cb)

subject: Run test-matrix.py under python3 if present
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 17:15:26.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Run test-matrix.py under python3 if present

This checks for the presence of python3 and if present installs the
python3 deps for test-matrix.py and then runs test-matrix.py under
python3. This is useful because as OpenStack grows more python3
compatibility we remove a python2 dep in the test env allowing people to
potentially have python3 only test envs.

Change-Id: I9253f3c5875e8c06f5dcb90b7a6c1c95c05d89cb
'}]
commit_message:
Run test-matrix.py under python3 if present

This checks for the presence of python3 and if present installs the
python3 deps for test-matrix.py and then runs test-matrix.py under
python3. This is useful because as OpenStack grows more python3
compatibility we remove a python2 dep in the test env allowing people to
potentially have python3 only test envs.

Change-Id: I9253f3c5875e8c06f5dcb90b7a6c1c95c05d89cb

commit_message:
Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section. Migrate the
setting from the old warnerror one.

Change-Id: Icd5cf4c279c566e1eddeede8df11a9d1c4d4c83f

commit_message:
Default to empty list for CinderNfsServers

CinderNfsServers must be provided a list, rather than a string,

defaults for this parameter appropriately.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 04:13:20.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I0a830532fc36965f10338e8e8ce951374bda126f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I0a830532fc36965f10338e8e8ce951374bda126f

subject: Allow '00' in base_mac arg for get_random_mac
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 20:37:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/utils/net.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/utils/test_net.py'], 'message': "Allow '00' in base_mac arg for get_random_mac

Currently it's not possible to use 00 in the base_mac argument
of get_random_mac. This patch suggests to use a character that
is not apart of the hexadecimal positional numeral system and
also is more easier to understand when using the funciton.

Change-Id: Ia7582bb011d82583229e953ffd466ec9acb66573
"}]
commit_message:
Allow '00' in base_mac arg for get_random_mac

Currently it's not possible to use 00 in the base_mac argument
of get_random_mac. This patch suggests to use a character that
is not apart of the hexadecimal positional numeral system and
also is more easier to understand when using the funciton.

Change-Id: Ia7582bb011d82583229e953ffd466ec9acb66573

commit_message:
Fix api-ref build

The api-ref document does not build anymore with current Sphinx and
os-api-ref extension due to invalid JSON files.

Fix all json files so that they are valid files and thus Sphinx can
parse and highlight them.

Change-Id: I3ca513f9f78efe8cb667591834dff7fabc6d0de9

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-06 02:05:19.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/local.conf', 'doc/source/plugins/nova.rst'], 'message': 'docs: fix notify_on_state_change conf group

The "notify_on_state_change" option in nova.conf
is in the [notifications] group which is specific
to nova, not the [oslo_messaging_notifications] group
which is specific to oslo.messaging.

Change-Id: I6ab394bcd9cc09ba06f82c7c18e10edca6bd8bac

commit_message:
docs: fix notify_on_state_change conf group

The "notify_on_state_change" option in nova.conf
is in the [notifications] group which is specific
to nova, not the [oslo_messaging_notifications] group
which is specific to oslo.messaging.

Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I6ab394bcd9cc09ba06f82c7c18e10edca6bd8bac

subject: Move eventlet monkey patch code
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 13295, 'name': 'Mario Villaplana', 'email': 'mario.villaplana@gmail.com', 'username': 'mariojv'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}, {'_account_id': 14629, 'name': 'HPE Proliant', 'email': 'proliantutils@gmail.com', 'username': 'proliantci'}, {'_account_id': 19003, 'name': 'Fujitsu iRMC CI', 'email': 'fj-lsoft-irmcci@dl.jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'Fujitsu_iRMC_CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19339, 'name': 'Dell EMC Ironic CI', 'email': 'openstack-ironic-ci@dell.com', 'username': 'openstack-ironic-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-02 11:53:00.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/cmd/__init__.py', 'ironic/__init__.py', 'releasenotes/notes/apache-multiple-workers-11d4ba52c89a13e3.yaml'], 'message': 'Move eventlet monkey patch code

Eventlet monkey patching is not recommended on top level __init__ [1],
because Apache WSGI module uses own concurrency model [2] and API
service under Apache should be runned without eventlet. This patch
moves eventlet monkey patching code to ironic.cmd module __init__
(like in nova).

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/eventlet-best-practices.html
[2] http://modwsgi.readthedocs.io/en/develop/user-guides/processes-and-threading.html

Closes-Bug: 1608252
Change-Id: I887a06566dcc2f09875f975f1e12ae4ff75fd348
'}]
commit_message:
Move eventlet monkey patch code

Eventlet monkey patching is not recommended on top level __init__ [1],
because Apache WSGI module uses own concurrency model [2] and API
service under Apache should be runned without eventlet. This patch
moves eventlet monkey patching code to ironic.cmd module __init__
(like in nova).

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/eventlet-best-practices.html
[2] http://modwsgi.readthedocs.io/en/develop/user-guides/processes-and-threading.html

Closes-Bug: 1608252
Change-Id: I887a06566dcc2f09875f975f1e12ae4ff75fd348

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-06 10:28:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_vscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_iscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/npiv.py'], 'message': "Read volume id from BDM connection_info['serial']

The volume drivers in nova-powervm get the BDM volume_id from
connection_info['data']['volume_id']. This value is not filled in
by all cinder volume drivers.

Adding code to get volume_id form connection_info['serial'] which

Change-Id: I1804d327c076ad76e63f4b5e6eefb11950ac7906
Closes-bug: #1657840
"}]
commit_message:
Read volume id from BDM connection_info['serial']

The volume drivers in nova-powervm get the BDM volume_id from
connection_info['data']['volume_id']. This value is not filled in
by all cinder volume drivers.

Adding code to get volume_id form connection_info['serial'] which
gets filled in nova block_device.

Change-Id: I1804d327c076ad76e63f4b5e6eefb11950ac7906
Closes-bug: #1657840

commit_message:
Move repo URL variables to defaults

This patch deprecates the apt/yum specific variables
and moves the common URL variable to defaults to make
it possible to override without using extra-vars.

This technique matches the mechanism used in the
galera_server role.

Change-Id: Iaf9a23d1cbc0601d13bf2e467437d3775da9c812
Related-Bug: #1669897

subject: Add missing STIG ID tags
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-05 07:49:34.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rhel6stig/misc.yml'], 'message': "Add missing STIG ID tags

The 'Set fact for SNMP being installed' and 'Set fact for vsftpd being
installed' tasks rely on variables being registered by other tasks. If
those other tasks are skipped by tag, Ansible can fail with an undefined
variable error. Add the appropriate STIG ID tags to these set_fact tasks
to include them when skipping by tags.

Change-Id: If6345d7095676cc703140ab95d60a5383a5ebef0
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing STIG ID tags

The 'Set fact for SNMP being installed' and 'Set fact for vsftpd being
installed' tasks rely on variables being registered by other tasks. If
those other tasks are skipped by tag, Ansible can fail with an undefined
variable error. Add the appropriate STIG ID tags to these set_fact tasks
to include them when skipping by tags.

Change-Id: If6345d7095676cc703140ab95d60a5383a5ebef0

commit_message:
Add idempotent_id lines for tests

All tempest tests should have a line to identify the
test with a unique UUID.  This patch adds the line
@decorators.idempotent_id('UNIQUE_UUID')
to the beginning of the test cases, and also adds
a line to tox.ini to check for the proper existence
of this line.

Change-Id: I02b1d7936423d351c7d9b236aaebe54dee3e174a
Depends-On: I18f5c726513b68083d8a5793b8eb391b421b8514

commit_message:
Add ability to publish nova host aggregate info for libvirt metrics

This change will enable operators to view overall vm utilization data by
nova host aggregate if they choose to.  By specifying a regular
expression matching host aggregate names in the new config file setting of
'host_aggregate_re', matching hypervisors will have the dimension
of 'host_aggregate' published on operations metrics.

Change-Id: Ifa298efc7362b123f5f4db97fd37cc0edc9a1686

subject: Stop killing conntrack state without CT Zone
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-04 03:43:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_conntrack.py'], 'message': "Stop killing conntrack state without CT Zone

The conntrack clearing code was belligerenty killing connections
without a conntrack zone specifier when it couldn't get the zone
for a given device. This means it would kill all connections based
on an IP address match, which meant hitting innocent bystanders
in other tenant networks with overlapping IP addresses.

This bad fallback was being triggered every time because it was
using the wrong identifier for a port to look up the zone.

This patch fixes the port lookup and adjusts the fallback behavior
to never clear conntrack entries if we can't find the conntrack
zone for a port.

This triggered the bug below (in the cases I root-caused) by
killing a metadata connection right in the middle of retrieving
a key.

Closes-Bug: #1668958
Change-Id: Ia4ee9b3305e89c958ac927980d80119c53ea519b
(cherry picked from commit ff3132d8d455012b2b29f1eb65817f8492f84fe9)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop killing conntrack state without CT Zone

The conntrack clearing code was belligerenty killing connections
without a conntrack zone specifier when it couldn't get the zone
for a given device. This means it would kill all connections based
on an IP address match, which meant hitting innocent bystanders
in other tenant networks with overlapping IP addresses.

This bad fallback was being triggered every time because it was
using the wrong identifier for a port to look up the zone.

This patch fixes the port lookup and adjusts the fallback behavior
to never clear conntrack entries if we can't find the conntrack
zone for a port.

This triggered the bug below (in the cases I root-caused) by
killing a metadata connection right in the middle of retrieving
a key.

Closes-Bug: #1668958
Change-Id: Ia4ee9b3305e89c958ac927980d80119c53ea519b
(cherry picked from commit ff3132d8d455012b2b29f1eb65817f8492f84fe9)

commit_message:
Add comment to instance_destroy()

The instance_actions and instance_actions_events tables are handled
differently than most when we soft-delete an instance.

It's not immediately obvious why this is, so let's add a comment
explaining what's going on.

Change-Id: Ie353650861c2911e4f55628c55f049fc1756e591

subject: Stop accidentally removing docker-distribution
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 13:38:50.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/docker_registry.pp'], 'message': 'Stop accidentally removing docker-distribution

By default Puppet does virtual package matching if precise name matching
fails. Docker-distribution RPM "provides" docker-registry:

bash-4.2# rpm -q --whatprovides docker-registry
docker-distribution-2.5.1-1.el7.x86_64

This means that when we wanted to make docker-registry package absent,
we were actually removing docker-distribution instead. This is now fixed
by allow_virtual => false. Only name matching is performed.

Related BZ: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1428826

Change-Id: I1f93b404085f0bc2b6c063f573c801db6409c0bb
Closes-Bug: #1666459
(cherry picked from commit d12c004bc9c630c756a6b0df351916b9e04b9778)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop accidentally removing docker-distribution

By default Puppet does virtual package matching if precise name matching
fails. Docker-distribution RPM "provides" docker-registry:

bash-4.2# rpm -q --whatprovides docker-registry
docker-distribution-2.5.1-1.el7.x86_64

This means that when we wanted to make docker-registry package absent,
we were actually removing docker-distribution instead. This is now fixed
by allow_virtual => false. Only name matching is performed.

Related BZ: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1428826

Change-Id: I1f93b404085f0bc2b6c063f573c801db6409c0bb
Closes-Bug: #1666459
(cherry picked from commit d12c004bc9c630c756a6b0df351916b9e04b9778)

subject: nova/neutron: Use to network-dependant interface and not hardcoded fqdn
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-03 12:04:44.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-base.yaml', 'puppet/services/neutron-base.yaml'], 'message': "nova/neutron: Use to network-dependant interface and not hardcoded fqdn

Currently neutron and nova expose their hostname via the ::fqdn fact,
this is not appropriate since it doesn't allow deployers to change the
network that services should be listening on.

This currently works since the ::fqdn that results from that call
happens to have the same IP as the network that services are listening
on, however, we shouldn't be relying on this. If the network is
changed, the ::fqdn value won't match a name where services would be
actually listening. Changing this value addresses that.

Nova's host parameter has to match the fqdn for neutron's agents, so
this paramter uses the value from the neutron network.

Partial-Bug: #1669746
Change-Id: Ib9c006583519008bfb55c0a3c96f41595833f458
"}]
commit_message:
nova/neutron: Use to network-dependant interface and not hardcoded fqdn

Currently neutron and nova expose their hostname via the ::fqdn fact,
this is not appropriate since it doesn't allow deployers to change the
network that services should be listening on.

This currently works since the ::fqdn that results from that call
happens to have the same IP as the network that services are listening
on, however, we shouldn't be relying on this. If the network is
changed, the ::fqdn value won't match a name where services would be
actually listening. Changing this value addresses that.

Nova's host parameter has to match the fqdn for neutron's agents, so
this paramter uses the value from the neutron network.

Partial-Bug: #1669746
Change-Id: Ib9c006583519008bfb55c0a3c96f41595833f458

commit_message:
Prepare vagrant centos/7 box for role testing

This will fix the follwing issues when using the centos/7 box for role testing:

* TASK [../../../openstack-ansible-security : V-38476 ...
  fatal: [centos7]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "Missing CentOS 7 GPG keys"}

  The required gpg-pubkey packages are created after the import of the provided signing keys
  in /etc/pki/rpm-gpg.

* TASK [../../../openstack-ansible-security : V-38574 ...
  fatal: [centos7]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "Must use SHA512 for password hashing (via PAM)"}

  sha512 instead of md5 has to be used in /etc/pam.d/password-auth

* TASK [../../../openstack-ansible-security : Check password hashing algorithm used in login.defs (for V-38576)] ***
  fatal: [centos7]: FAILED! => {"changed": true, "cmd": "grep '^ENCRYPT_METHOD.*SHA512' /etc/login.defs", ...

  sha512 instead of md5 has to be used in /etc/login.defs

Change-Id: Ia40119dbf933b8102001cfe914312b17632bcf65
Co-authored-by: David Rabel <rabel@b1-systems.de>

subject: Raise specific exception for an invalid protocol connector
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-02 19:08:13.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connector.py', 'os_brick/exception.py'], 'message': "Raise specific exception for an invalid protocol connector

Nova's libvirt driver attempts to load up a set of volume
drivers which use os-brick connectors on start of the
nova-compute service. If there is a missing or invalid
mapping, like ISER + s390x, it results in a ValueError and
nova-compute fails to start.

This change raises a specific exception, which is still a
ValueError for backward compatibility, so that Nova can
handle this situation gracefully and not crash.

Change-Id: I1d016c226416cf2b77d6e0393498905f56fd8cde
Partial-Bug: #1639239
(cherry picked from commit f7b8d242f7125242eebf0f72532daa931d5bb59f)
"}]
commit_message:
Raise specific exception for an invalid protocol connector

Nova's libvirt driver attempts to load up a set of volume
drivers which use os-brick connectors on start of the
nova-compute service. If there is a missing or invalid
mapping, like ISER + s390x, it results in a ValueError and
nova-compute fails to start.

This change raises a specific exception, which is still a
ValueError for backward compatibility, so that Nova can
handle this situation gracefully and not crash.

Change-Id: I1d016c226416cf2b77d6e0393498905f56fd8cde
Partial-Bug: #1639239
(cherry picked from commit f7b8d242f7125242eebf0f72532daa931d5bb59f)

This change updates the image script to search for the parent image via the
Docker 'FROM' tag throughout the Dockerfile. The script previously checked
for parent name of an image, assuming that first line of Dockerfile always
starts with FROM, but that is not always the case when using custom

Change-Id: I176d99f4e4896b64435e495526154c8f4c684839

(cherry picked from commit 07101562e3eb477dbb1246f8c2097143de4e6327)

commit_message:
Improve kolla image build script for finding parent images

This change updates the image script to search for the parent image via the
Docker 'FROM' tag throughout the Dockerfile. The script previously checked
for parent name of an image, assuming that first line of Dockerfile always
starts with FROM, but that is not always the case when using custom
Dockerfiles.

Change-Id: I176d99f4e4896b64435e495526154c8f4c684839
Closes-Bug: #1656206
(cherry picked from commit 07101562e3eb477dbb1246f8c2097143de4e6327)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-28 09:00:27.000000000', 'files': ['Vagrantfile', 'tests/vagrant.yml'], 'message': 'Prepare vagrant centos/7 box for role testing

This will fix the follwing issues when using the centos/7 box for role testing:

* TASK [../../../openstack-ansible-security : V-38476 ...
  fatal: [centos7]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "Missing CentOS 7 GPG keys"}

  The required gpg-pubkey packages are created after the import of the provided signing keys
  in /etc/pki/rpm-gpg.

* TASK [../../../openstack-ansible-security : V-38574 ...
  fatal: [centos7]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "Must use SHA512 for password hashing (via PAM)"}

  sha512 instead of md5 has to be used in /etc/pam.d/password-auth

* TASK [../../../openstack-ansible-security : Check password hashing algorithm used in login.defs (for V-38576)] ***
  fatal: [centos7]: FAILED! => {"changed": true, "cmd": "grep '^ENCRYPT_METHOD.*SHA512' /etc/login.defs", ...

  sha512 instead of md5 has to be used in /etc/login.defs

Change-Id: Ia40119dbf933b8102001cfe914312b17632bcf65
Co-authored-by: David Rabel <rabel@b1-systems.de>
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare vagrant centos/7 box for role testing

This will fix the follwing issues when using the centos/7 box for role testing:

* TASK [../../../openstack-ansible-security : V-38476 ...
  fatal: [centos7]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "Missing CentOS 7 GPG keys"}

  The required gpg-pubkey packages are created after the import of the provided signing keys
  in /etc/pki/rpm-gpg.

* TASK [../../../openstack-ansible-security : V-38574 ...
  fatal: [centos7]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "Must use SHA512 for password hashing (via PAM)"}

  sha512 instead of md5 has to be used in /etc/pam.d/password-auth

* TASK [../../../openstack-ansible-security : Check password hashing algorithm used in login.defs (for V-38576)] ***
  fatal: [centos7]: FAILED! => {"changed": true, "cmd": "grep '^ENCRYPT_METHOD.*SHA512' /etc/login.defs", ...

  sha512 instead of md5 has to be used in /etc/login.defs

Change-Id: Ia40119dbf933b8102001cfe914312b17632bcf65
Co-authored-by: David Rabel <rabel@b1-systems.de>

commit_message:
Add pre_test_hook.sh for devstack tempest gates.

Pre-test hook is called before executing tempest tests
in the gate. Before tempest tests are run, this script
adds necessary rbac parameters to tempest.conf.

Adopted from [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/contrib/ci/post_test_hook.sh

Change-Id: I67d6a820cdb2406e76603a598324fab1f9403799

commit_message:
Move Consistency Groups out of Volumes panel

Notes on enabling consistency groups in devstack:
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/blockstorage-consistency-groups.html

You'll also need to modify the local cinder policy file.

Though that's not actually enough to make it work since
devstack only provides the LVM volume type and CGs don't
work with LVM. You can attempt to create CGs, but they
will error.

Change-Id: I0ab541c81570cd5f67bb7d04c01bc92bc5cc3ab5
Implements: blueprint reorganise-volumes

subject: Still wait for hooks on failed resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-17 16:36:25.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Still wait for hooks on failed resources

Previously, if a resource was in a FAILED state Heat would set the hook
but not wait for the user to clear it before continuing. It is not clear
what case this was designed to handle, since there's no way that I know
of for the resource to go into a FAILED state while waiting for the
hook.

Change-Id: Iaacc585b9806c08fd5a57c80c10eeb31cb0a8f71
Closes-Bug: #1665699
"}]
commit_message:
Still wait for hooks on failed resources

Previously, if a resource was in a FAILED state Heat would set the hook
but not wait for the user to clear it before continuing. It is not clear
what case this was designed to handle, since there's no way that I know
of for the resource to go into a FAILED state while waiting for the
hook.

Change-Id: Iaacc585b9806c08fd5a57c80c10eeb31cb0a8f71
Closes-Bug: #1665699

subject: Add --utc flag to cron trigger create
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-06 13:17:33.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/commands/v2/cron_triggers.py', 'mistralclient/tests/unit/v2/test_cli_cron_triggers.py'], 'message': 'Add --utc flag to cron trigger create

The server should not be doing any translation of times. It should be
assumed that what is sent to the server is being sent as UTC. The
addition of the --utc flags facilitates this. If the --utc flag is
specified, then the --first-time passed is assumed to be already
UTC and will not undergo a conversion. If it is not passed, the
--first-time arg will be converted based on the the localtime of the
client, then sent as UTC.

Change-Id: I424d042d1cbdadae3aa14cd408d9f27d14823aef
Depends-On: Ifbd63d9e1f56085928bede22ce4f2954e1b38991
Closes-Bug: #1654218
'}]
commit_message:
Add --utc flag to cron trigger create

The server should not be doing any translation of times. It should be
assumed that what is sent to the server is being sent as UTC. The
addition of the --utc flags facilitates this. If the --utc flag is
specified, then the --first-time passed is assumed to be already
UTC and will not undergo a conversion. If it is not passed, the
--first-time arg will be converted based on the the localtime of the
client, then sent as UTC.

Change-Id: I424d042d1cbdadae3aa14cd408d9f27d14823aef
Depends-On: Ifbd63d9e1f56085928bede22ce4f2954e1b38991
Closes-Bug: #1654218

subject: Fix copied openrc files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-05 13:41:17.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/config/demo-openstackrc.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/osbash/copy_openrc.sh', 'labs/osbash/config/admin-openstackrc.sh'], 'message': 'Fix copied openrc files

Our openrc files load some values from configuration files. For the
copies in the home directory, the relative paths are wrong.

This patch replaces the variables with constants which a) ensures
that the file works regardless of its path and b) is easier to
understand for the user.

We also replace the "controller" hostname in the openrc files with
the equivalent IP address so the openrc files works also on the
user's host machine.

Change-Id: I237f2449f8d2d5bd52166b8267b384900935b133
'}]
commit_message:
Fix copied openrc files

Our openrc files load some values from configuration files. For the
copies in the home directory, the relative paths are wrong.

This patch replaces the variables with constants which a) ensures
that the file works regardless of its path and b) is easier to
understand for the user.

We also replace the "controller" hostname in the openrc files with
the equivalent IP address so the openrc files works also on the
user's host machine.

Change-Id: I237f2449f8d2d5bd52166b8267b384900935b133

subject: playbooks: roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Reboot VM if boot fails
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12459, 'name': 'Stephanie Miller', 'email': 'stephane@alum.mit.edu', 'username': 'cinerama'}, {'_account_id': 22474, 'name': 'OPNFV CI', 'email': 'opnfvci@gmail.com', 'username': 'opnfvci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-02 10:26:18.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/files/create_vm_nodes-for-role.sh'], 'message': "playbooks: roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Reboot VM if boot fails

This is another attempt to solve boot problems similar to the following
ones:

net0: 52:54:00:4a:4e:de using rtl8139 on PCI00:03.0 (open)
  [Link:up, TX:0 TXE:0 RX:0 RXE:0]
  Configuring (net0 52:54:00:4a:4e:de)................ Error 0x040ee119
  (http://ipxe.org/040ee119)
  No more network devices
  No bootable device.

If boot fails (according to the BIOS' perception) then we reboot the VM.
This will assist in proceeding with normal boot in case of spurious iPXE
or DHCP problems.

Change-Id: Ibf5ec1a5d858f6e3cd510daefaf999313f4e03fc
"}]
commit_message:
playbooks: roles: bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Reboot VM if boot fails

This is another attempt to solve boot problems similar to the following
ones:

net0: 52:54:00:4a:4e:de using rtl8139 on PCI00:03.0 (open)
  [Link:up, TX:0 TXE:0 RX:0 RXE:0]
  Configuring (net0 52:54:00:4a:4e:de)................ Error 0x040ee119
  (http://ipxe.org/040ee119)
  No more network devices
  No bootable device.

If boot fails (according to the BIOS' perception) then we reboot the VM.
This will assist in proceeding with normal boot in case of spurious iPXE
or DHCP problems.

Change-Id: Ibf5ec1a5d858f6e3cd510daefaf999313f4e03fc

subject: Rename ClusterTemplate in OpenStackCloud docs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-01 19:55:00.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_cluster_templates.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Rename ClusterTemplate in OpenStackCloud docs

There is no ClusterTemplate object in shade. A
cluster template is a resource in shade as any
other, such as a project or a server, which is
returned as a dict.

This patch renames "ClusterTemplate" to "cluster
template" in order to be consistent with how shade
refers to the rest of the resources in the
OpenStackCloud docs.

In addition, it is not useful for shade users to
know ClusterTemplate is the new name for BayModel.
If shade had ever supported a BayModel resource,
it would still support it.

Change-Id: Icbf4b310c5bbfb912c902f66974e11d8cefe1e23
'}]
commit_message:
Rename ClusterTemplate in OpenStackCloud docs

There is no ClusterTemplate object in shade. A
cluster template is a resource in shade as any
other, such as a project or a server, which is
returned as a dict.

This patch renames "ClusterTemplate" to "cluster
template" in order to be consistent with how shade
refers to the rest of the resources in the
OpenStackCloud docs.

In addition, it is not useful for shade users to
know ClusterTemplate is the new name for BayModel.
If shade had ever supported a BayModel resource,
it would still support it.

Change-Id: Icbf4b310c5bbfb912c902f66974e11d8cefe1e23

commit_message:
Remove service names in OpenStackCloud docs

OpenStackCloud users are not necessarily admins.
They do not need to map cloud resources to the
underlying services managing them.

commit_message:
Remove calculation for NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork

This patch removes the calculation that set the
NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork configuration based on the number of
"controllers" being deployed. With composable roles, this is incorrect
and the default, if required, should be determined by the number of
neutron dhcp agent services being deployed - not a role count.

Closes-Bug: #1632721
Depends-On: I06628764c4769d91bbc42efe1c722702d6574d02
Change-Id: If202a8255f8ad9f662f0d66a5f630f1b7ae60a26

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-28 15:42:21.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/allow-neutron-dhcp-agents-per-network-calculation-536c70391497256d.yaml', 'puppet/services/neutron-base.yaml'], 'message': 'Make neutron dhcp agents per network conditional

While the heat templates specify a default value of 3, it rarely seems
to have an effect as the tripleoclient is setting this according to the
controller scale. This was fine before composable roles, but it is now
invalid. While the client needs to be modified to no longer set this
according to controller scale, the template should default to a sentinel
value that will allow the puppet code to determine the proper value by
the number of hosts that have the neutron dhcp agent deployed on them.

Depends-On: I5533e42c5ba9f72cc70d80489a07e30ee2341198
Partial-bug: #1632721
Change-Id: I06628764c4769d91bbc42efe1c722702d6574d02
'}]
commit_message:
Make neutron dhcp agents per network conditional

While the heat templates specify a default value of 3, it rarely seems
to have an effect as the tripleoclient is setting this according to the
controller scale. This was fine before composable roles, but it is now
invalid. While the client needs to be modified to no longer set this
according to controller scale, the template should default to a sentinel
value that will allow the puppet code to determine the proper value by
the number of hosts that have the neutron dhcp agent deployed on them.

Depends-On: I5533e42c5ba9f72cc70d80489a07e30ee2341198
Partial-bug: #1632721
Change-Id: I06628764c4769d91bbc42efe1c722702d6574d02

subject: Default neutron dhcp_agents_per_network to number of agents
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-03 12:21:36.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/calculate-dhcp-agents-per-network-3089c5e7b15f8b7b.yaml', 'manifests/profile/base/neutron.pp'], 'message': "Default neutron dhcp_agents_per_network to number of agents

This patch will set neutron's dhcp_agents_per_network equal to the
number of deployed neutron DHCP agents unless otherwise explicitly set.

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/neutron.pp

Note: spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_neutron_spec.rb removed from
backport as it required defining the neutron class as a precondition to
satisfy a requirement for a rabbit password. This leads to a duplicate
definition.

Partial-bug: #1632721
Change-Id: I5533e42c5ba9f72cc70d80489a07e30ee2341198
(cherry picked from commit 52a68ffc8f060e1961458a524e5861cea02d1c1c)
"}]
commit_message:
Default neutron dhcp_agents_per_network to number of agents

This patch will set neutron's dhcp_agents_per_network equal to the
number of deployed neutron DHCP agents unless otherwise explicitly set.

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/neutron.pp

Note: spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_neutron_spec.rb removed from
backport as it required defining the neutron class as a precondition to
satisfy a requirement for a rabbit password. This leads to a duplicate
definition.

Partial-bug: #1632721
Change-Id: I5533e42c5ba9f72cc70d80489a07e30ee2341198
(cherry picked from commit 52a68ffc8f060e1961458a524e5861cea02d1c1c)

commit_message:
remove list_oslo_unreleased_changes.sh

This is a simple wrapper, not often used. The version that lists all
libraries is more common, and has been migrated to the releases repo in
an earlier commit.

Change-Id: I0ceec83c816379620f161f64ea60ce1b89b01c3f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
